security: Classified Secret since we refer to CIA's use of Levy abroad. He furnished information concerning possible violation of export regulations regarding shipments to Cuba by International Ore and Fertilizer Company, a large and reputable firm.
summary: The FBI is forwarding information to the CIA regarding Herbert Levy, Director of Central Operations at St. Regis Paper Company, who provided information on Cuban economic matters and had previously been a source for the CIA on matters concerning India.
summary_one_paragraph: In a memo dated December 11, 1961, FBI Director J. Edgar Hoover informs the CIA's Deputy Director of Plans about Herbert Levy, Director of Central Operations at St. Regis Paper Company, who provided a memorandum from Salt Lake City concerning Cuban economic activities. Levy, who had previously supplied information to the CIA while residing in Houston, Texas, on matters related to India, contacted the agency again. The FBI is sharing this information while ensuring Levy's identity remains confidential, particularly concerning his association with the St. Regis Paper Company and any other commercial entities; the FBI states they contemplate no further action in this matter.
title: CIA LIAISON MATERIAL
